title: Excellent care
body: I recently had to give birth without my partner because we were waiting for the results of a covid test. The midwives were very kind and reassuring before, throughout and after the birth. When there was a problem with the isolation room I was in initially they found me another room and took care to ensure I was comfortable there and had calm and privacy during early labour. They later acted very promptly when there were concerns over my baby's heart rate. Even when the situation looked more urgent and lots of staff were in the room doing different things to me, someone would always respond to my questions  and all the drs and midwives treated me with dignity and respect, explaining what they were doing. I also felt that during the different stages of labour the midwives listened carefully to my description of what was happening even when it didn't match with their assessment of my contractions. In the end my daughter was delivered naturally and safely just as I was about to be taken for an emergency c section. The midwife who looked after me following the birth was very conscious of the fact that I was without my husband and offered to take photos of me and the baby so that I could send them to him. I am very grateful for the way all the staff helped to mitigate what could have been a very scary and negative experience.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Good carer and autism awareness
body: This surgery has a positive attitude towards supporting me as a carer and my daughter who has complex autism. In particular the GPs have listened carefully and acted quickly to support us through a potential crisis which made a huge difference. I have every confidence that they really care about our welbeing and that they have high professional standards. I wouldn't hesitate to ask if I needed any extra help for her to access the surgery or wider healthcare provision. Finally I find the reception and pharmacy staff to be very pleasant and helpful. These little things mean a lot if you are having a difficult day.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

title: Brilliant
body:
From my initial contact with receptionist at local surgery to discharge nurse today, the NHS have been absolutely faultless. Cannock hospital was very fast from Speed to have my MRI, my consultation and keyhole surgery on my knee today. Everybody‚Äôs attitude was excellent throughout and all were good for a laugh. 
Can‚Äôt forget New Cross earlier this week either for my COVID-19 test. Drove up, never got out of car, gone in less than 3 mins. Superb organisation. 
THANK YOU NHS ‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

title: Wonderful staff
body: Had to attend the breast institute today. The service I received was amazing. All the staff were so kind and thoughtful. It made what was a frightening experience very good. Thank you to you all

title: Excellent care
body: I attended LHAC on 31 July for ablation.  I can honestly say from the minute I booked in until I left later that day the staff were amazing.  During the procedure everything was fully explained and I was constantly being reassured throughout, which certainly did put me at ease.  On the recovery ward the nurse was fabulous.  Constant obs being taken and genuine care.  So much so she even arranged for me to have tea early so I could be discharged at a convenient time !  I would not hesitate to recommend this hospital - they all go way and above the call of duty and are true professionals.  Thank you all.

title: Great personal skills
body: This is based on a couple of visits to our house by Stafford ambulances, the latest being in August. The paramedics were extremely professional and did there job great and made you feel confident but on top of that I was amazed at how good each paramedic were on making us feel comfortable and easing an emotionally difficult and worrying situation . They were very good at diffusing worry, and reducing panic - asking about kids and the dog etc and just made the whole thing feel so much better. They also put our mind at ease where they could about the situation my husband was in and explained things in laymans terms whilst giving us enough information to understand what they were doing at all points. I was very very impressed. Thank you so much to the paramedics

title: Great caring service
body: Had to attend today with my mum who is 90 the staff took great care of my mum and took the time to listen to her they were very caring and attentive

title: Incredibly helpful
body: I've only ever had an excellent service. Always gotten an appointment promptly and felt doctors have gone over and beyond to help.  Thank you.

title: Excellent service
body: I attended the Community Eyecare centre in Newcastle under Lyme for a Laser Capsulotomy procedure. Excellent and swift treatment from very friendly and professional staff. The procedure was pain and discomfort free and completed within minutes. My eyesight is now excellent. Thank you so much.

title: Absolutely terrible service
body: I have waited over 10mins while the phone range for an emergency appointment.  I spoke to a receptionist who put me on hold for over 10mins - I presume the line got disconnected.  I rang again and eventually I was put through and then phone cut off immediately.  I am now waiting for a third attempt - it has taken me over 40mins and I am furious.  I will be leaving this practice

title: Was left feeling unhappy and lost with what to do‚Ä¶
body: I called up for a blood test and when i called for the results they were normal however the problem was still not resolved for me as it had been ongoing and will be without any treatment. I called to book a face to face appointment which I could only get a phone call appointment that was difficult enough considering i needed the doctor to see me in person. After the appointment the doctor said that i would be called back  with more information on how they can help but instead received a text saying that there was no treatment available for me and was referred to the nhs website which i had already been on previously myself when researching into the health issue and it said to see your GP which i was trying to do. I was left feeling like there was actually nothing wrong with me when there clearly was something  not quite right it was making me feel depressed and for someone young to be having these symptoms is not normal.  I felt that the doctor hardly seemed interested when it came to my mental health. I had no recommendations or directions on what i should do next but finally in the end I received a face to face appointment like i should have done from the beginning although i have to wait until the end of the month.

title: Brilliant Care
body: I was admitted to Ward 20, and would like to thank every single member of staff . They made my stay as comfortable as possible , and nothing was too much trouble . You are all Angel's and thank you again for the compassion and care you showed me .

title: Waited 9 hours for treatment
body:
I went to A&E with bleeding that would not stop. Triaged and taken to A&E quickly then waited 4 hours before I was examined by a doctor despite having a complex medical history. Then sent to sit in the busy waiting room for another 3 hours before an attempt was made to stop the bleeding sent back to the waiting room unable to wear a mask as the bleeding was in my mouth and I had been asked to apply pressure. Other patients were not wearing masks properly or pulling them down to talk so felt at risk. This attempt did not work. Not enough treatment bays for patients to sit in. No information provided about waiting time. Staff discussed patients in voices loud enough to be heard in the waiting room. Two patients left against medical advice after waiting for hours without being seen. Finally seen by a very caring competent doctor from another department who stopped the bleeding and provided advice about what to do over the next few days. The doctor I saw in A&E was very nice but clearly overworked. 
I unfortunately have had quite a lot of experience of attending hospitals in an emergency in a different part of the country but this is the worst experience of having to wait with no apology for having to wait so long or any interaction from staff to check people who have been waiting for hours are ok I have ever had. I am hoping this was a particularly busy afternoon/evening and that the care provided in A&E is usually better.

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great improvement
body: I used the new online service two days ago and I booked a phone consultation which I received in just a few hours. I received a thorough review of my problem and got the help I needed. My prescription is out for delivery already. Much improvement on the old system.

title: Fantastic service
body: Always have had great service and care from the practice and reception staff always so helpful. One hears so many complaints about peoples experiences of other surgeries I feel so lucky to have you as my doctors surgery. I feel you go a ove & beyond what is expected. Cannot fault in any way.

title: Superhero‚Äôs are real
body: I went in to be induced and this turned into an emergency c section due to cord coming 1st. All the maturity unit worked together and saved my baby. words don‚Äôt cover how grateful Me and my partner feel. All the staff are amazing and so friendly. They checked up on me regularly and made sure I went home when I felt well enough. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts üíû

title: great treatment
body: The nurses, doctors in fact all staff very polite. Very helpful and responsible. All questions answered and satisfactory replies given.

title: Excellent Hospital
body: From the first outpatient visit through being admitted, having surgery on spine, follow up and discharge the treatment was first class.  The staff worked as a team and were caring and efficient.

title: Top marks from start to finish
body: I went as a day  patient for a carpal tunnel procedure. Everyone I met was friendly. The nurse who welcomed me and, at the end, advised me on how to ensure the wound healed well communicated everything superbly and in a very friendly way made me well aware of what was required for success! The young female surgeon was confident, efficient and put me at my ease. A success all round.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank you
body:
I am currently at home recovering from gall bladder removal surgery following a chronic gall bladder infection at the start of the pandemic and am writing to acknowledge the care I received throughout the process by the Northern General Hospital prior to my surgery with the NHS at Thornbury Hospital in Sheffield.

From my treatment by the Out of Hours GP Unit at the Northern General, the Out Patient staff who diagnosed my condition, the Waiting  List staff who on contacting me, answered my initial questions and subsequent follow up queries, the Pre Operation Assessment Nurse who over the phone provided me with practical information about what to expect from the surgery,  the NGH Support Worker at who did my ECG and took my bloods, the Laboratory staff who processed my bloods and Covid samples, the Cleaning teams whose efforts in maintaining high standards of cleanliness which were evidenced all around the hospital, THANK YOU.

readBy.name: Sheffield Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank you
body:
I am currently at home recovering from gall bladder removal surgery following a chronic gall bladder infection at the start of the pandemic and am writing to acknowledge the care I received from Thornbury.

From the pre operation phone call from a staff member the day prior to my admission to talk me through the process and enable me to discuss any queries I had, the warm welcome at the hospital from the Nurse who then admitted me and put me at my ease, the Anaesthetist and Surgeon and the nursing and support staff who conducted the operation and the Nurses who cared for me following the operation, and the Nurse who cared for me through the night and discharged me the following morning.

The  Pharmacy who dispensed my prescription, the Catering Staff who provided good food and endless supplies of iced water and cups of tea, and the Cleaning and Laundry teams whose efforts in maintaining high standards of cleanliness were evidenced throughout the hospital.

Thank you to everyone concerned, everyone I had dealings with were lovely and as a Trust you should be immensely proud of your team.

Lesley Ingamells

title: Byzantine
body:
I appreciate that these are unprecedented times etc but the set up to get even a phone appointment is ridiculous and baffling. They are not signed up to any online booking system - which would eliminate many problems at a stroke - so you have to phone reception.

I phoned on a Monday to book a phone consultation and was told that "we don't release appointments until 9am on Tuesday so you'll have to phone back then for an appointment next Wednesday." I mean, this in itself is baffling (what do they mean "releasing appointments" - are they under house arrest?)

My bafflement must have been palpable, for the receptionist then hurriedly offered me a phone call from another practice (in Morley) either that night or later in the week.

We know that doctors aren't seeing anyone in person, but the idea that I can't even get a phone appointment inside a week and can't even *book* one until a specified day is mystifying. They could literally take a phone number and offer to call back at the first available opportunity or have an online system or... something. So, in the end, I didn't even speak to a doctor from the practice, but someone in Morley (who are presumably working extended hours to cover, apparently beyond Leigh View). 

To be honest, this sounds kind of trivial. But that's because it's the tip of a loooong iceberg. I've been with the practice all my life  and getting any appointment - even in normal times - is now such a bother, with a front desk who are often (but not always) audibly exasperated at requests to see a doctor, and with a waiting time to see a named doctor now running at well over a month.

Anyway, I don't want this to become a tedious whinge about receptionists - who probably cop a lot of flak for problems created by practice managers, but I'm registering with another GP after 45 years.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Terrible,
body: Have been with them the last two years, I've been in there 3 times without one good experience. Shameful the way the deal with mental health. As a family we have decided to change doctors surgeries.

title: Great Practice
body:
Always so helpful and efficient.
I am a 65 year old man so have had quite a few GP‚Äôs from several practices in various locations over the years.
Dorking medical practice is without doubt the best - head and shoulders above the rest. Well done and thank you.

title: Wonderful Staff
body: I attended Spa Medica for a cataract operation. The treatment I received from entering the building to leaving was absolutely first class and I was made to feel confident and assured. The operation was successful and I await my next appointment with confidence. A big thank you to everyone at Hull

author: outflowxw98
title: Care in the community
body: the care services through care in the community from Beaumont House Hospice in Newark during the day when my father was very ill were exemplary, the carers not only looked after our father but also made sure our mum, myself and my sister were coping.   The Nottinghamshire Hospice offered a night sitter for my mum on several occasions whilst our father was ill so that we were able to take a break and get some rest.   We cannot thank these wonderful ladies enough for the care, understanding and sympathy that they provided to our father and to us during the time he was very ill.

title: Excellent improvement
body: We have been with this surgery for over 40 years and it has never been as efficient as it was yesterday. I phoned and explained my symptoms to the receptionist. The doctor phoned me within the hour. She listened, made a diagnosis and sent a prescription to the local pharmacy. I was able to collect it immediately. A great improvement.

title: Changing doctors
body: So sick of trying to call up and being on hold for hours and when I do get through they cant do nothing to help with my chest pains. Said I was going to get a call back which I never did at all just makes me think I should just register else where considering they have been my doctor since my heart and kidney surgery they dont even want to no now such a shame as was a very good place probly the beat around clacton not anymore. And well the staff are so rude that I wont actually call the doctors no more the attitude is horrible like they dont even care at all

title: Ist in line on telephone for 40 minutes.
body:
It might have improved a bit Victoria Clinic but if they do not answer the telephone what is the point of all the generous funding that they receive.
No Stars Today.

title: Lack of common sense
body:
Request on 30/03/2020 for the completion of a form to support my insurance claim for a proposed holiday due to start on 03/05/2020.  (My request was supported by a cheque for ¬£35)
 The completed from was returned to me 13/08/2020 signed by the doctor on 07/08/2020. A bit late.     What a waste of the doctor's time. It would seem the Practice would benefit from  a new Practice manager  or a review of its administrative system.    I had assumed that the form had not been completed as a result of the lock down and that the practice would realise or at least check with me whether the form still needed completing.

title: Excellent service and facilities
body:
Online prescription request and appointment system very useful.
All staff friendly and helpful.
Comprehensive website.

title: Second cataract op Aug 2020
body: Had my first cataract op in March 2020 a week prior to lockdown.  The result was amazing and I couldn't wait to have the second eye operated on.  I wrote to SpaMedica in July enquiring when the second eye op would take place.  I was surprised under the current situation to have the second op in August 2020.  After a couple of days my eyesight improvement was out of this world. I am extremely short-sighted, minus 9 in both eyes.  I am now able to see, drive, etc without glasses or contact lenses.   I cannot thank SpaMedica enough.  All the staff are so professional and helpful.  Thank you so much.

title: Exceptional Service
body: Life has changed beyond belief following a call to the GP.  Feeling heard and understood has restored my ability to parent the way I feel necessary. We are now at the start of a very lengthy process, but without the GP's support we would still be stuck.  The GP in question went above and beyond to help at a time when stress levels were already elevated (Coronavirus).  I cannot rate the service highly enough on this occasion.

title: Disappointment
body:
I appreciate we live in strange and difficult times but I  am not happy.I attended the surgery last week ,the doctor was concerned with my symptoms and said I needed to go to A&E for tests he even wanted me to go in an ambulance !I said I would get my husband to take me. He asked me to monitor my symptoms, book a blood test an then go back to see him. When attending for my blood test I tried to make my follow up appointment only to be told I couldn't and could only have a telephone consultation. I explained that I had been asked to go back but because the doctor hadn't put that in my notes it wasn't allowed. The hospital did find some things that needed looking into.I find it very strange that something as important  as seeing a doctor is still being limited in this way when other 
establishments are starting to open up.

title: Absolutely shocking
body: Came here today with my 7 month old daughter. Was put in a side room and left for 4 and a half hours nobody came to ask if we was ok or even if we needed anything.. When I managed to ask the nurses if they knew what was happening 2 out of the 3 I spoke to were damn right rude. People were coming in and being seen before us and when I questioned this I was told it was due to them being ill.. Well doh that‚Äôs exactly why I‚Äôm at the urgent care with my daughter because she‚Äôs ill too.. Then we were told our daughter wasn‚Äôt a priority. I

readBy.name: Lincolnshire Community Health Services NHS Trust

title: Treatment At Home, Bolton
body: I found it very disappointing when being treated at home by the Bolton Homebased Treatment Team. There was a distinct lack of communication from staff about who was attending for appointments and no planning in advance. I didn't know who my keyworker was or found questions I asked where seemingly ignored. None of this helped in my recovery with this team. I appreciate times are difficult during Covid19 and staff are under immense pressure and I take this into account when writing this review. But I found the support patchy and disheartening and didn't feel I benefited from being under the service for the time I was.

readBy.name: Greater Manchester Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Brilliant Service !
body: I was referred to to Spa Medica St Caths in July I received a pre-op appointment on 3rd August everyone of the staff were very professional at the end of the examination I was told to go to reception for an an appointment for my cataract operation,I was amazed to be told that they could do it on Thursday 6th! I jumped at the chance.On the day of the op I was taken through the pre - op procedure and after the anaesthetic drops had taken effect,about 45 minutes I was taken into surgery ,the operation took about 10 minutes and I was allowed to be picked up shortly after.I was so impressed with the professionalism of all the staff .I was kept fully informed of every step of the process .I was supplied with pre-op and post op booklets that reassured me .I couldn't recommend Spa Medica more strongly.Top Marks!

title: Poor care
body:
I attended with concern about tissue infection from some bites on my ankles, which were extremely swollen. The wounds were weeping and there was a reddened area across the foot which was hot and I was struggling to weight near.

Before entering I was asked if I was experiencing any Covid19 symptoms, which I was not. I provided a history and whilst doing so my temperature was taken. 

My temperature was 38.2, so I was told immediately to leave and recommended that I book in for a Covid test. I queried my concerns about infection and both medics queried whether either had touched the area by way of examination. They both acknowledged they hadn‚Äôt, but said they looked absolutely fine and the priority was to book a Covid19 test and self isolate.

My temperature rose further through night, but dropped the following morning. My ankle pain has worsened and I was unable to put any weight on one foot at all.

I attended A&E where they identified immediately that the there was progressive cellulitis that required immediate treatment with anti-biotic, as left untreated it could develop into sepsis. 

Whilst I appreciate we in the midst of a pandemic (and I went for a test as a precaution), it was clear that my high temperature triggered a Covid concern, when the situation in front of the medics was one where infection was the obvious explanation for the high temperature.

The visit was also shortly before closing, which I was reminded of, and the exact words used were ‚Äúyou‚Äôve got a temperature, so the best advice we can give is to get away from us as quickly as you can and also go and get yourself tested and self-isolate.‚Äù

Had I relied upon the advice, I would not have sought further medical advice and would have remained at home for 10 days whilst infection spread in my body.

Trying to relieve the burden from the front line professionals in A&E was not beneficial to me, or them, on this occasion. Advice from the A&E professionals was to ‚Äúwalk past the walk-in‚Äù in future and go straight to them. Sound advice, I think!

title: Terrible
body: Do the drs ever see patients all i wanted was 5min aptt with nurse  for reassurance over a leg injury 3 hrs 3 phone calls and tx with px for a/b and painkillers how the hell can you just pump out a/b without even looking my pharmacist had a look and said it wasnt infected so didnt need a/b nhs are forever telling gp to stop giving them unless absolutely nessesary   the surgery has realky gone downhill since you began this new trial which is nothing to do with covid because you started this in jan ive been with this practice since i was born and havent never felt so worried about being ill and needed this service which  now just isnt there anymore its is dreadful what is someone supposed to do if they feel ill i dont want to go through  a 3 degree and then be expected to then sit waitung for goodness knows how long then to get another call with more questions and still not a word in person eg dr just anither msge third hand

title: Excellent Practice
body:
I have been at this surgery for over 10 years. The staff and the doctors should be praised for the outstanding jobs they do. I have never had an issue getting an appointment. When you see how busy they are patients should understand that the phone will unlikely be answered immediately. I have observed a patient giving the staff a hard time at the desk which is really unfair as you can see they are doing ther best to accommodate all patients. The surgery is modern, clean, organised, the staff are incredibly friendly and helpful and the doctors really know their stuff.
Thank you

title: Brilliant Care
body:
I had an appointment in the morning to have a lesion check with a dermatologist which turned out to be benign but I was also offered a check of other moles and because of this thorough practice, another mole which was a bit of a concern was identified. In what seems to me to be outstanding efficiency, the biopsy was the same afternoon and all of this was on a Saturday!

The whole experience could not have been better: really clear explanations by the clinicians who treated me and warm, friendly care all round. 

I am so impressed that this was all offered on a Saturday and amidst COVID 19. I could see how hot and uncomfortable all the PPE was that the professionals who did my biopsy were wearing and I am so grateful to them for their cheerful and professional care in what must be incredibly demanding circumstances.

The whole Dermatology Department is a model of efficiency and superb care. From the thoughtful check-in to the meticulous admin to the doctors and nurse clinicians - it is an example of brilliant teamwork.

Thank you for your kindness and outstanding care. 

Best wishes,

Una Heaney

title: Poor service
body: I have tried all day to call Devon doctors after being referred by 111. Due to being in a poor signal area I missed the ‚Äú3 calls and you are out‚Äù what sort of service is that? Why do I not get left a number to ring back. Instead I get to start the whole process again to be told there are no emergency appointments left. I am now left in extreme amounts of pain with no one interested in helping great service....

title: Great Secretary
body: Thank you for the secretary who helped me with my referral to the hospital.  Very kind professional and once again thanks to the secretary.

title: Great practice
body: Receptionist was very helpful and friendly and GP was caring, professional and understanding. That‚Äôs what one needs in time of need when feeling unwell. I fully recommend this health centre.

title: Exceptional Care
body: I visited the Gynae - Oncology department yesterday for an outpatient appointment and I was most impressed with the service I received from reception dept and nursing staff to the consultant. The hospital is working under challenging circumstances and the staff go over and beyond and I would like to say thank you.

readBy.name: Digestive Diseases Centre, Royal Sussex County Hospital

title: Allowed home unsafely
body: My neighbour was permitted to self disclosure herself following the expiry of her section 2. She went home to her husband who has Parkinsons and was unable to cope. Support fell mainly to me, their neighbour. I love them dearly but should never have been put in this situation.

readBy.name: Dorset HealthCare University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Amazing compassionate care
body: Within minutes of a consultation I was in an ambulance to A&E. After 2 months in hospital with a very low chance of surviving, after discharge the practice organised occupational therapy and physiotherapy plus social services intervention through their wellbeing team. Even under Covid-19 restrictions they cared enough to do home visits and arrange for district nurses to monitor my health.

readBy.name: Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

title: Quick service
body: After a bad fall onto my knees  on a concrete floor,with consequent massive swelling bruising and pain I visited the clinic after 10 days when my knees has got worse rather than better. I waited outside for a few minutes before having temperature taken and then went to the waiting room . Gave details at the desk and waited, saw the doctor and got a prescription for strong antibiotics as my knee had an infection. The whole process took 55 minutes. Safe distancing observed throughout waiting period. Recommend an umbrella if it‚Äôs raining as little shelter outside. Very happy with service.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Reassuring and swift service
body:
I was referred by my doctor for a cancer investigation, And I had an appointment booked for 4 days after my call to my gp! I was concerned that due to the pandemic I might have delays in being seen by someone but can‚Äôt believe how promptly I got an appointment (especially if you believe what they say in the news!). 

The new hospital at chase farm is spotless, there were lots of people to help guide you to where you are going and I waited minimally to see the doctor followed by a scan (shout out to the lovely nurse who was in the ultrasound consultation, a true asset to the clinic), everything was very well organised and all of the staff were friendly and reassuring. I got the results the same day, all in under an hour, it was very impressive.

I can‚Äôt rate the entire experience highly enough, though I don‚Äôt know what the experience would be like for someone who has regular hospital appointments, my experience of the breast cancer clinic was excellent.

title: speedy service and helpful staff
body: truly excellent service and individual attention, no waiting in a large waiting room. straight in to receive immediate attention from the very helpful staff. If only all hospital attendances were like this.

title: Unsung Heroes !!!
body: I have been a patient at this practice for many years and would like to express my thanks and gratitude to the support staff who are often the forgotten unsung heroes. Unfortunately, four years ago I needed their help for a serious condition, to date, I still require their support. Every six months I require the surgeries assistance to supply consumables to maintain my long term intravenous line. Their hard work, empathy and understanding is very much appreciated and always welcomed. Everything you do is much appreciated and I cannot thank you enough and will always owe you a debt of gratitude. The support staff are unsung heroes and are an asset to this excellent medical practice.

title: Best patient care in area
body: I am making a positive review as the NHS is under so much pressure and often receives a lot of negative feedback and people don't always remember to appreciate the good bits. I have been a patient at this practice for years and have always been treated incredibly well. I have chronic health problems which can take a lot of the nurses and doctors time. I always feel comfortable and listened to. My experience at Naseby Medical Centre has been exceptional. I have been reassured and looked after The staff have always been kind, honest, and incredibly knowledgable about a range of problems and treatments. The GP here who I have the most contact with has worked ever so hard over the past few months, writing multiple letters to the hospital, speaking to my consultants and spending time explaining everything to me. They are clearly going beyond what is required of them which makes me, and I'm sure other patients under their care, feel valued and safe. It was a really negative experience with another doctor during a hospital stay which has triggered me to write this review. I am incredibly grateful to have such an excellent GP practice and such kind, caring, competent and committed staff. The reception staff and admin team are also friendly and helpful. Thank you for looking after the patients so well even under such huge pressures from the NHS and the world.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: friendly helpful service
body:
The two nurses from the eye clinic helped my mum with taking the eye pressure test at the drive through eye unit on Dobhill Street on the Wednesday 12 August 2020.
Both very friendly and helpful with the test.
Thank you -  Brian White

title: Econsult service
body: This is the first time I have used this service. There were a couple of issues in trying to submit appropriate econsult information in that one answer provoked the response of calling 111 or going straight to A&E when not necessary. The second issue was waiting throughout the day for a clinician/doctor response. When it came the phone did not connect first time causing frustration with the inability to ring back or text. It would be a much better service if the patient knew a time slot of say 3 hours when contact would be made. This happens at other surgeries. Having said that when the Doctor finally rang back he was very helpful.

title: Fantastic treatment
body: I am overwhelmed by the treatment my mother has received at Boroughbury, she is new to the practice and the respect and care she has received has been wonderful. Thank you

title: Wonderful Care
body: I received Antibiotic Therapy from the OPAT Team. I must admit I was worried about having a line put in to receive antibiotics at home from the team. Right from the beginning I was greeted by very professional staff some full of jokes but all very cheerful after this stressful year for all. The team were fantastic people an asset and it made me feel so cross that nurses in general were passed over for a pay rise yet again when they have done so much, been so dedicated and not one had an unhappy face. They all deserve so much more for the service they all give. The quality of care I received was second to none. Thank you very much all of you its sheer dedication and you are all so dedicated to your profession whatever.

readBy.name: Great Western Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Service
body: I was strongly recommended to go to A&E after being seen by my GP,  as it seemed like i had an abscess rupture in my left buttock. The entire team at St Helier have been nothing short of amazing. There were so many people i have encountered and too many names to recall, but each & everyone off them has been fantastic. They ensured that I was OK every step of the way. I had to have 3 blood transfusions because my blood levels were so low. They were all ever so emphatic towards me & i really felt so confident that i was in the best care.

title: Wonderful staff.
body: Just had an MRI scan at Treliske,  what efficient and friendly staff, really impressed especially during this horrible time. The 2 gentlemen who took care of me were absolutely charming and thoughtful. A credit to the hospital, thank you so much.

title: Thank-you
body: Thank-you to the entire team at Moorefields. I presented in excruciating pain & loss of sight and couldn‚Äôt have been cared for in a more compassionate and engaging way. From my first clinician exam before seeing a doctor, everything was explained and re-explained so i knew what was happening and through to treatment, the team displayed empathy and patience, dispute queues building up. Thank-you

title: Extremely unhelpful team
body:
I have been with this surgery for years now but it seems the receptionist are further trained to be unhelpful. They specialise in working against patients rather that working with or even for their patients. Not only are they rude and care less about human but they also come up with the most senseless things ever. For example, they refuse to accept a hand delivered letter for one of the doctors which contained patient medical information from another medical consultant. Their reason was ‚Äúbecause of Covid‚Äù. Ask what if the postman delivered it? Their response was it will go through screening. I understand they have to take precaution but so am I and a sensible one too. Not that it‚Äôs guaranteed the postman is covid free. My son needed an emergency inhaler due to asthma, he was told by the receptionist to complete a repeated prescription form which takes 2 days. I also had to wait 2 days to get a simple information that could have been provided by the receptionist. The appointment system only favours the unemployed. The staff just makes it impossible in every way for any service patient need. They are quick to refer you to somewhere else like the chemist or other health centres. This is not right. Something must be done. These people need training on how to relate to human needs and some customer service skills. 
The doctors on the other hand are very good once you get to see or speak to them.

title: Hygiene
body: The staff were all caring. The surgeon and staff who performed the procedure were good, but unfortunately something happened and I got after surgery MRSA which caused me 6 weeks recovery as all my C section opened again and I spent 4 weeks on antibiotics. 1st time mum and I felt terrible not enjoying my baby due to lots of pain and blood. I just want people to be more conscious with the hygiene in hospitals, especially having a newborn I couldn't carry on with breastfeeding or taking care due to so much pain and swelling; internal stitches came out and that's when everything started to get better. Sharing my experience is helping others to be more alert with hygiene. I know I signed a consent for things could happen, but I think things like this shouldn't happen.

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Refused admittance
body:
After phoning 111 my elderly father was referred here for a suspected thrombosis following surgery. We were told it closed at 9pm and travelled for thirty minutes to get him there. On arrival at 8.30pm we were told they had closed at 8pm. The two members of staff refused to check my fathers condition. They did not offer him a chair or wheelchair. They declined to check the referral documentation.  My elderly, frail, pale, catheterised and potentially very sick father was shown not a glimmer of concern, care or compassion. 
The staff did not want to hear our explanation that 111 had sent us and we were just following the correct procedure. They just wanted us to leave which we did.

title: Delayed Call Back
body:
I called 111 on Thursday, August 13th at 6.40 pm. I explained to your advisor that I was bleeding profusely with pain when I went to pass water and I knew the appropriate medication since I had recently had the same problem, a bladder infection. My local Sainsbury's pharmacy was open until 9pm and ASDA pharmacy - nearby in Crawley - was open until 10 o'clock.
At 11pm a Doctor called to ask if anyone could collect my medicine. I said no because it was late to wake the neighbours and the chemists were closed. She suggested requesting an ambulance but I declined because I needed the medication.
 She then suggested sending a prescription to my local chemist that I could collect in the morning. This was unhelpful since it meant me suffering all night and I could speak to my GP in the morning myself.
At around 12.45 pm another Doctor called to say that I could either collect the medicine from Haywards Heath hospital or pick it up when the Chemist was open.
I am disgusted with the service that I have received. I am a 73 year old woman with a history of high blood pressure and heart palpitations. I realise that 111 is busy but I explained my problem and the corrective medicine. What more do you need to know !
I suffered all night when a call within 2 hours would have solved the 
problem. 
Monireh

title: excellent service
body: from the moment we arrived under these difficult circumstances (covid) everything moved on from section to section alot faster than what I was anticipating. Well done to you all and thankyou very much for your continuous hard work

title: Dr's medical staff  no problems -- Reception‚Ä¶
body: After another event with trowbridge h/c reception staff , I was told that reviews are not read - well , how will things ever change ?  The medical staff are very badly let down by the way the reception staff treat their patients , everything is a problem and we are the cause ? .Perhaps a read of the patients charter may improve their dis-respectful attitude to the patients views , trying to discuss a problem is pointless as nothing will ever be resolved by staff who believe they are faultless and refuse to listen to any complaint .  They continue to believe they are faultless . I intend to take this complaint further . We deserve better .  this complaint is to trowbridge staff only . please do not return your standard reply - no point in talking when no one listens .

title: Rude nurse but everyone else was kind (Fracture‚Ä¶
body: Visited Southend hospital on Tuesday the 11th of August 2020 at 10pm. The receptionist was nice to me and understanding. I then got transferred to the fracture clinic in the hospital and again the receptionist was helpful and friendly towards me. However nurse who was in charge of the ward that night was very rude to me. I politely asked when I will be seen as I had been there for 2 and a half hours and it wasn‚Äôt major but needed to be seen at hospital and I‚Äôd thought it would of been easier to get me out of the way. And she rudely replied to me saying I have no idea and carried on speaking bluntly without making any eye contact and then walked off saying I‚Äôd be next to be seen. Half an hour passed and someone else was seen then I politely said excuse me do you know when I‚Äôll be seen as you said I was next but someone has just been called. She continued to be rude to me and argue back to me and I said to her I don‚Äôt appreciate being spoken to rudely like when I first spoke to you and she said neither do I and stormed off. This was Infront of everyone in the waiting room. I felt like this was very disgraceful to be treated like especially for my first hospital visit. Very unprofessional in that job role when I thought importance was to be kind especially in this pandemic. Despite this, all over staff I saw in my visit seemed very nice and caring.

title: Perfect
body: Lovely centre and staff. Asked permission from my daughter for everything they did and explained everything to her along the way

title: Caring and reliable.
body: Been coming here for years and have always had a great experience. Recently despite the challenging times I was seen quickly and referred immediately. Always friendly and efficient clinical and admin staff.

title: Inexperienced and Irresponsible
body:
This organisation may well have methods that are beneficial for chronic alcoholics but it has virtually no experience when it comes to understanding binge drinking, it's psychology and the health risks involved.

This puts binge drinkers using the service at risk of disability and death due to uneducated staff members whom act in a medically irresponsible way. 

I was accused of merely being intoxicated at a time when I was actually suffering from alcohol poisoning and its after effects (due to consuming too much alcohol too quickly), low electrolytes (due to the volume of fluids consumed with said alcohol) and hypocalcemia (a malabsorption problem that is due to an underlying autoimmune condition I suffer from).

I needed medical attention but when I asked for it I was merely accused of being drunk and of partcipating in nusiance behaviour because on several occasions I called out the emergency services to assist me and/or collapsed on the sidewalk outside. 

Recently I was served with an antisocial behaviour contract by them because I collapsed and passed out outside whislt trying to walk to the shop some hours after my previous binge had ended when what I really needed was urgent medical attention. 

I would recommend that anyone suffering from a binge drinking problem get help elsewhere.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Unprofessional
body:
I stayed overnight on Wildgoose ward with my 15 year old daughter on Saturday 15th August.
I cannot fault the care given overnight.
However, I found the nursing team that were on duty on Sunday 16th August to be extremely unprofessional. The nursing team included HCA‚Äôs, 2 x student nurses, staff nurses and a ward sister. The team were accumulated around the nurses station watching videos on one of the student nurses phones and laughing extremely loudly. We could hear all of their conversations - none of which were work related. This behaviour went on for some time. I found it difficult to concentrate on what the paediatric consultant was saying over the volume of their ‚Äòshrieking‚Äô. 
At the beginning of the day shift the ward sister came across to reset my daughter‚Äôs IV pump and didn‚Äôt even take the time to introduce herself or to ask how we were doing.
We‚Äôd had a very traumatic 12 hours and their demeanour left a lot to be desired; this did not help our anxiety levels at all. Very disappointing and totally unprofessional.

readBy.name: Plymouth University Health and Human Sciences students, 2018
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Worrying lack of covid 19 precautions
body: Walked whole of main corridor from top car park to Out Patients before anyone asked about COVID symptoms. At no time were our temperatures taken. First hand sanitizer at entrance To hospital was empty.

title: Great superb practice
body: Nice hospital, nice members of staff - Decent people: caring and hospitality 5/5 10/10 hospital highly recommended

title: Quality care and amazing professional people
body: On arrival the receptionist saw us struggling to get from the car to the door and assisted us with a wheelchair.  Once registered the assessment nurse also saw our struggle and immediately asked someone to see us in a room with a bed as I had badly damaged my knee.  Once assessed the level of care was second to none.  I had 19 stitches across my knee.  Which took a while and the person who completed this task was amazing and considerate to my fear and pain, as was his assistant.  The nurse who completed my obs and did my final dressings was brilliant and funny keeping my spirits up.  I could not have asked for a better team to have assisted me following my accident. Fully down to my stupidity.  Thank you all so much I am so sorry to have taken up so much of your time but truely appreciated all you did.

readBy.name: North Cumbria Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic practice all staff very helpfull
body:
I have been a patient with the Mansfield Medical Centre since 1983 (37 Years) and have experienced nothing but proffesionalism and respect from the reception staff and all the practise Doctors over all the years.
I am proud to say I am a patient here. 
The reception staff and Doctors go out of there way to help all patients, with their enquiries and health issues.
All the doctors are committed to their patients, and care about them. The Doctors work extremely long hours, above and beyond what is required. Thank you all for you dedication and committment............... Especially during these difficult times with Covid-19 I am proud of our NHS and it's committment to people.

title: Ward 35
body: Great thanks all night staff and doctors and nurses and what amazing job they do and it clean place just wanted to say big thank you too everyone

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Exceptional level of expertise and immediate‚Ä¶
body: For two decades Fort House Surgery has looked after me brilliantly, devotedly and with a level both of medical expertise and immediate attention that is exceptional and most remarkable.  I am writing this now because, especially given the present extraordinary demands the doctors, nurses and staff are having to endure, it is extremely commendable that I have yet again received the highest possible level of personal and professional dedication at immediate notice.  I wish to thank the doctors, nurses and staff for the very expert service they instantly give me - both the physical and psychological benefits of this are indispensable.

title: Bad Experiences can't keep on being a "coincidence
body:
I have had a few bad experiences over the last year at PAH & feel they can't keep on being a "coincidence".

I worked briefly for the trust last year and felt compelled to make a complaint about another staff member following her foul & abusive language towards me.

Since then I have had the problem with the treatment regarding my broken shoulder - (on page 2 of this site), not just the wrong treatment but also the rudeness I experienced from 2 staff  members, plus the abruptness I have received from some people at the Blood Test Unit, plus now with my leg injury.

As I said it can't keep on being a "coincidence" and wonder if something has been said, or maybe, put on my records. If so, that to me would be discriminatory for what was effectively "whistleblowing".

I have requested view of my records but do wonder whether I will be allowed sight of them or whether things will be "removed" from them to cover up any discrimination.

title: A & E plus Acute Medical Department & Necton Ward
body:
I have had several visits to A & E after blacking out and falling downstairs hitting my head several times & catching my right shoulder & arm on corner of bannister. Eventually landing on concrete tiles in the hall. Each time I attended they were marvellous I can‚Äôt speak highly enough of them. I had head CT scans and X-rays. I fractured my wrist and had it plastered again they were exemplary. I was sent back to Casualty as I
was having breathing difficulties. My BP was very low as were my oxygen levels plus I was dehydrated. I was admitted to the Emergency Medical Ward where I had Chest X-rays and CT scan of my lungs with an injection. Each department treated me very well, it was discovered I had a Chest infection. I was transferred to Necton Ward where the Consultant told me I had Pneumonia, I was on IV antibiotics 3 times a day for eight days, oxygen for 6 days & IV fluids for 5days. I cannot say enough to praise all the staff, they were rushed off their feet but  nothing was too much trouble. Whilst in there I also saw an Endocrinologist regarding my under active thyroid & I am to be seen in clinic by him. I was discharged after 9 days, I have to go back for a further chest X-ray. The QE Hospital has some really amazing caring staff, who look after you very well. I have to say thank you very much to all the departments and staff

readBy.name: The Queen Elizabeth Hospital Kings Lynn NHS Foundation Trust

author: keer80
title: Autism Services
body: My child has autism and has special needs. There are lots of services in the area for children with autism but children with both autism and special needs cannot take part in them due to their special needs. I feel that staff do not have the knowledge to accommodate special needs.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: perseuszk45
title: Family
body: Shocked at way family was let down there was no follow up or clinic that was mentioned followed though to get my family member on the right track to get better. Shocking

author: Raffe the Giraffe
title: Bunker mentality
body:
Earlier this year I was discharged by the North Ayrshire Adult Community Mental Health Team based at The Three Towns Resource Centre. Over the last few years the treatment I received from this service and wider mental health services has been appalling. This is reflected in a complaint I submitted being upheld by NHS Ayrshire and Arran and the SPSO. However, the service failed to acknowledge this and other failings (including not responding to me when I was at crisis point) which contributed further to a lack of trust and respect between all parties.  
In particular the doctor I was under continued for several years with an antagonistic and accusatory approach, was dismissive of anything I had to say, delayed a referral by almost two years, cancelled CPN input by way of ultimatum and dismissed the advice of another doctor after seeking their opinion. This doctor went on to falsely claim I was a danger to my child saying a referral would have to be made to Child Protective Services; thankfully this wasn‚Äôt followed through.  
Frequently they would apply labels and make statements which were a completely inaccurate portrayal of me or my circumstances. This was often played out in front of other staff members which helped give leverage to the false claims and statements. This in turn led to the wider team including management acting as though they have a bunker mentality where it seemed to me like defending their colleagues was more important than my welfare as a patient or acknowledging previous mistakes/shortcomings.  
Sadly the only consistency I have observed from this service has been their the woeful underperformance in recent years, perhaps reflected in their inability to timeously update their outdated operating procedures.

readBy.name: North Ayrshire Health & Social Care Partnership
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: LINN
title: Misdiagnosed for years
body:
Misdiagnosed for years when suffering low thyroid.  
Also went to surgery with skin issues for 3 years and during this time seen by a specialist and the person in question, who is no longer there, told me "do not come back there is nothing we can do".  
Later after persisting and getting a referral for a biopsy, was diagnosed with skin sarcoidosis, in January 2020. Awful service and well below standard.

author: B Griffiths
title: A full hip replacement
body:
I had a full hip replacement December 2018 on my left side ,and 3 months later i had the same thing carried out on my right side ,both at the care uk ilford site.Duing the healing process i was taking tramodol painkillers,along with other medication ,and also doing some light exercise.  
After 6 months i went to my GP and said that my left hip didnt feel right when compared to the right hip, eventhough the right hip had been operated on 3 months after.The right hip had heald perfectly well,I had an exray or the left side, and was told it was ok and was just part of the healing process. But the left hip was still painful and uncomfortable so I ended up in A&E where they looked at the left hip and found that there was a problem. Now I'm back on the waiting list were i was 10+ years ago ,with know idea when i will be treated.Because √≤f this,i decided to self fund my next set of treatment with care uk so i can rectify the problem and claim my life back, But I was told by care uk that they only carry out full procedures, so I will have to find alternative treatment elsewhere. I find this callous in that, as they have already received payment for the original opperation,and they seem to want to wash their hands of any further involvement regardless of any pain or suffering the patient is left in.

author: Striving to improve standards
title: Ward leader and lack of efficacy
body:
I had a family member in 5C in the RVH. From the first day they communicated, the staff were rude and ignorant to us and only for the good communication from medical staff she would no nothing regarding her care. The ward leader never spoke to her as a patient except to tell her off for something. I feel like in their senior role they should attend advanced communication. The ward staff do not follow "Hello my name is" or wear name badges  
As regards to track and trace, they did not take any contact details off the nominated visitors so how would you ever trace anything if a covid positive ever turned up in a bay. You simply couldn't. There was no staff member controlling anyone coming into the ward or ensuring that staff members signed in. A trolley for masks sits at the nurses station where you have walked through 50% of the ward with no protection on. On days it has taken be four hours of ringing the ward through switchboard to get booked in for visiting. This is very inadequate  
I have witnessed infection control standards being poor during this pandemic, staff walking up and down the corridor with aprons and clothes on that they wore whilst seeing a patient within a bay. I am certain that this breaks protocol. The ward leader themselves was observed doing this. This should be fed back to staff before another patient receives and observes the same poor practices. Where anxieties are high already with being in hospital, watching this does not give confidence in nursing staffs ability to prevent the spread of infection

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust
Ulster University, Faculty of Life and Health Sciences

author: art1969
title: Appointment mess ups
body:
I should start by saying I have Addisons disease (secondary - my Pituitary gland is up the creek) and I am dependant on hydrocortisone dripped into me via a cannula for life. Signs of a 'crisis' - when I suddenly become low on cortisol are sight loss/numb face/droopy eye and this is happening often. My GP thought it prudent I visit an Optician (I did - she recommended I saw a Neurologist) and referred me to Neurology at East Surrey Hospital. After the covid-19 thing put everything on hold I was finally offered a video appointment with a Neurologist yesterday at 9am (over 3 months since my referral). After being 'checked in' I waited....and waited...and waited... for 25 minutes...on hold...until a conversation that sounded something like this:  
"sorry...the Neurosurgeon looked at your notes and says you need to see an Ophthalmologist - your issue isn't his department"...  
"Oh, but my GP and optician said Neurology needed to see me"  
"Nope. No. He doesn't need to consult with you."  
"but...but I have waited ages for this. I lose sight in my eye. My face goes numb and my eye droops I am a bit desperate - will he not just have a quick word? (*cue me getting all choked up)"  
"No."  
..."oh...err....OK. I will wait for the Ophthalmology call then"  
5 mins later - phone rings -  
"Hello - this is the Neurologists secretary - you need to change to an Ophthalmology video consult, yes?"  
...I give symptoms again...  
'Oh dear. That is certainly a Neurological issue. Yes you need to see a Neurologist...'  
'Yes, yes I know..."  
"I will try and sort this out - i'll call you back"  
....still not been called back.

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: OCT18
title: Post treatment Radical Prostatectomy
body: Discharged home with review date in 7 weeks, extremely poor communication, appreciate the impact of Covid 19 and have been very fortunate to have my surgery. However no support from Specialist Nurses to Consultants unwilling to listen to my very valid concerns. My partner works in the NHS however the care delivery is extremely different. Total lack of care and empathy from the acute sector. Feel very let down and angry.

author: Babygate19
title: My experience with maternity services
body:
I first of all have to say my first point of contact with a midwife was in springburn medical centre - pleasant enough, quite abrupt but also didn't really care very much as I had told them I would be moving to Renfrewshire. Not once did I get notes on myself, no little maternity book etc. Then I had meetings with maternity staff at the Royal (who were angels) - where I was sent unnecessarily, I assume because my BMI was high the health centre nurse thought I was high risk.  
However, then I got transferred finally to Renfrewshire perhaps 6 months down the line where I was given a midwife who was to remain mines until I gave birth -really clicked with this one! They were very Zen and we bonded. To then be given over to another midwife who to put it frank it seemed couldn't be arsed.  
Messed around by junior doctors at maternity services at RAH - told I would be induced at 38 weeks because baby was growing rapid, to then be told no I wouldn't be getting induced because the baby was then measuring small. To then come back and be told I would be induced however the consultant (finally got to meet) wanted the community midwife to do a sweep of which she refused - can I also reiterate that all "information" given by junior docs was none, nothing on induction, no informed consent on my part until I spoke with the consultant which I asked for otherwise would have been given another junior.  
Fast forward to my induction - maternity staff...AMAZING!! I can not praise the maternity staff at RAH enough. I was taken to labour suite around 12 after 3 pessaries over the necessary time etc. The midwife I had until shift change was lovely, bright and bubbly. However, my midwife for the Nightshift!! What an absolute angel! I will forever be thankful for their calm, informative and professional nature. The epitome of a midwife with added banter! I genuinely cannot praise this staff member enough. However, my labour was very long and this midwife had to leave just as everything was going wrong. Dilated fully then taken for a C-section. Again, the anaesthetic nurse - great at her job. Helped to calm my poor partner down. The anaesthetist threw the spinal in like a champ! Instant relieve. All the perioperative staff were great especially when I lost a lot of blood, so professional and astute. Dr Robbins, again what a lovely man -such a shame he has retired.  
Post op - I don't remember much but I was unwell and had a lot of drugs and blood transfusions. The staff were accomodating.  
Up the ward - left to my own devices, staff pleasant, some less so. No aftercare on c section, no guidelines or booklets about do's and don'ts. The Consultant who eventually discharged me, lovely mannerisms, spoke clearly, concisely and informatively to me.  
On return home after removal of my stitch my wound dehisced at several areas, serous fluid and blood all over my living room. Staff at maternity line so unhelpful and on attendance a very junior doc had a quick look and popped a few paper stitches over my leaking, gaping wound and sent me on my merry way. Appalled. The community midwives tried to help but were not so sure about wound management, having an already massive case load! However, perhaps a wee bit of training may help them if the services could provide!  
Thanks goodness for my practice nurse on the management of my wound.  
Overall, I am happy with my care all that mattered to me was that my baby was born safely. However, I feel maternity services could benefit with debriefs including patients after traumatic events/births after discharge. This would benefit any potential PTSD issues. Which is something I raised with a junior doctor about my apprehension to an induced birth due to increased risk of traumatic births, haemorrhage etc. However, I was dismissed. Luckily I was more traumatised by my gaping wound than my birth story. There is many training opportunities required. However, staffing needs improved and in my opinion the pay needs increased! Thankful for the NHS.

author: Letdown once again
title: Westmarc mobility centre
body: This week my father had an appointment at westmarc. As a seriously disabled man, who took a stoke at 6 years old and now at 59, he is deteriorating at a rapid pace, relies on his wheelchair for ANY quality of life but it is difficult to get him to the westmarc so we organise an ambulance to collect and drop off. This week, when they came they decided he was too difficult to help and decided ‚Äúno‚Äù and promptly left. Now I know this seems difficult to comprehend but it seemed there was not one shred of compassion here - it was simply a case of ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt get paid enough for this‚Äù and left. This meant we then had to be 60 pounds for taxis there and back for this. A family with little income, years and years of hardship and neglect, a system failing a man and then this. Unbelievable! We felt let down, ignored, obsolete and to be honest - disgusted but not surprised. How hard would it be for staff to have compassion? It beggars belief. The ambulance driver's attitude was atrocious!

author: Jenesse
title: Struggling to cope after many years of health problems
body:
I had a difficult childhood with abuse and neglect so have struggled with periods of depression all my life. Following complications from surgery in 2007 I have since suffered with severe pain, mobility issues and other problems. I've been on high doses of painkillers, had many surgeries, nerve ablation treatments and also had to have a colostomy. I was so exhausted by pain, ongoing health problems, medication and trying to work full-time that I felt unable to cope and suicidal.
I had a great counsellor at Inclusion Thurrock who helped me to go through and make sense of the overwhelming feelings I had and to find new perspectives, ways of coping and feel that although I do have challenges, I am strong enough to deal with them and actually the future has a lot of good things to offer as well.

author: Acam
title: Hope for a new life
body: I am currently working with CGL to become free of drugs. My key worker, Alexandra, is going out of her way to help me. Apart from long waiting times to get an initial appointment, the service is easily available to anybody who wants to make a change in their life. Alexandra and CGL gave me a hope for a new, drug free life; all I have to do is follow their advice. Thank you! ! !

author: Maxre7
title: Caring staff on Coniston ward
body:
written on behalf of some of the patients on Coniston ward;  
we want to praise the staff for how they have managedus (the patients) and the restrictions everyone (patients and staff) are currentlyexperiencing. The situation has and continues to be difficult andwe understand the reasons why things are as they currently are, but, it is becoming harder and harder for us not having any leave or visitors to the unit

title: The worst
body:
If I could give it no stars I would. Hence why I‚Äôve decided to transfer to another GP Practice. 

Main reasons are as follows: 

‚Ä¢ hard to get hold of reception staff and they try to palm you off as quickly as they can. 

‚Ä¢ never process PERSCRIPTION in time. They won‚Äôt put you on repeat so getting the okay from the doctor takes longer than two working days, 

‚Ä¢ Reception gives you INCORRECT test results. 

‚Ä¢ you get to see a GP finally, they aren‚Äôt able to do anything so they print you off an nhs information page to take home. Which really you could do yourself. 

It‚Äôs probably the worst gp practice going and I would implore you to go elsewhere. Poorly run place with poorly trained staff.

author: RMN2010
title: Poor staff attitude at OOH
body:
I contacted NHS24 due to escalating leg pain and shortness of breath that evening. I spoke with a nurse and then a doctor who asked me to attend Lister Street for medical review. He advised I had to be there for 23:45 as the centre closed at midnight. I said I would be there as close to that time as possible - this call ended at 23:28. I arrived at Lister Street from Galston at 23:47.  
On arrival I pressed the buzzer and was advised my appointment was quarter to and not ten to. I apologised and was granted entry. On entering a doctor was leaving and asked me if I had an appointment - I explained that I did. She continued to exit the building. On exiting both the doctor and a nearby porter began shouting over each other and to me that I needed to wear a face mask. I asked them to stop shouting as I was out of breath and uncomfortable. The doctor apologised - I put on a face mask noting that neither the doctor nor the porter were wearing one!  
I then sat in the waiting room for 5 minutes and at this point it was around midnight. I was called by an ANP who proceeded to ask me exactly what NHS24 had said about the appointment. They then complained that this ‚Äúis always happening to me‚Äù and how they would be speaking to a supervisor. Took basic obs and told me there would be nothing they would be doing and for me to see my GP in the morning.  
Now I am a registered nurse of 10 years and I am shocked at the insensitive and unprofessional way I was treated tonight. I accept that perhaps I did not require treatment that couldn‚Äôt wait after being reviewed, however, I can not accept the poor and rude attitude of 3 members of staff I encountered tonight! I felt like an inconvenience from the moment I walked in the door.  
The doctor left before the end of the shift and I believe knowing that I was their patient. The porter was rude shouting ‚Äúhey you‚Äù and pointing and shouting over the doctor at me in a frankly intimidating manner - marched in and out of patient area with no mask despite shouting at me to wear one. The nurse I spoke with I felt was also rude and unprofessional in discussing work place grievances in priority over assessment of me.  
I was 2 minutes late for my appointment! I would never treat patients in this way. End of shift or not - we have a duty of care. I came home feeling no more reassured or having any advice regarding my symptoms or how I could ease them. I should have had a medical review. Very poor.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

author: pepperff43
title: Volunteering for CGL
body:
I have recently been offered a position for the role of a Police Constable with my local police force. Of course I have accepted.  
Due to this I will not be able to continue my volunteering role with CGL. I just want to thank them all for the brilliant opportunities I have been given. Although my time at CGL hasn‚Äôt been the most straight forward (floods and COVID) I believe that I have developed and enhanced skills from my volunteering role, which I will carry on through to my career in the police.  
Thank you to all of the team for being so welcoming, supportive and helpful.  
I hope to see you all soon and maybe we will cross paths again when I am wearing my uniform üëÆüèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

author: Patient zero
title: Staff were truly amazing
body: I was admired in to Hairmyers a few days ago with type 1 diabetes and I must say the doctors and nurses and support staff were truly amazing so helpful and did everything they could to make sure I was looked after! I‚Äôm not a big fan of hospitals however this time was certainly memorable for all the right reasons! I can‚Äôt thank everyone enough for how they treated me! I know people won‚Äôt believe me but I‚Äôve actually had worse stays in 4 star hotels! So I‚Äôd like to take this opportunity to praise and thank all the staff who looked after me! Keep up the great work

author: KC8
title: Minor Injuries Unit
body: My 6 year old son had a fall when over at Balmaha.   He ended up with a deep gash on his right knee.   We attended the MIU at the Vale of Leven Hospital as this was closet on the way home.   Although the booking in was via the door entry intercom, the clerk was clear, helpful and put us both at ease.   Once in the nurse who attended to my son was excellent, she informed us she was a children's nurse.   She was able to put him at ease while she cleaned the wound and gave him a wee stitch.   All the staff who we came into contact were friendly and welcoming even thought it was a busy time within the unit.

author: Jmc89
title: Hospital admission and post-op care
body:
I was admitted to ward 49 (QEUH) following Gynaecological surgery. I would like to thank all the nursing staff, CSW‚Äôs and doctor (Mr Pringle) for their outstanding care. I had a fabulous experience, despite circumstances, they all were so caring, compassionate and are a credit to the NHS.I would also like to Thank my Day Surgery nurse Sandra, Theatre nurse Karen and recovery nurse Stephanie, who were all tremendous. I can‚Äôt sing their praises enough. Gifted nurses with big hearts.  
Thanks once again.

author: Revving
title: First-class service once again
body:
My regular 6 month appointment didn't happen because of Covid, and replacement parts were sent that appeared different.  
Phoned yesterday, and when the next slot wasn't until late September, Lee arranged for me to come in straight away. He explained that they had used my records, but the parts did look different.  
He fitted one replacement set and gave me an alternative set to take away, and explained any discomfort would show quite quickly.  
This morning I have swopped to the ones that better match the previous set.  
Some lateral thinking, a wonderful manner, professional and caring behaviours - Musgrove Park Hospital providing first class service once again.

author: ec20
title: Support
body:
I need to draw your attention to the work of the admiral nurses support network for carers of Dementia patients, a service so badly needed by so many.  
My Husband was admitted to R.C.H. Treliske during lock down ( For another reason ) and died unexpectedly while there (My Husband developed Dementia a year previousley ) both of us had been shielded patients at home.  
I had lost my soul mate and was on my own I didn't know how to cope with my grief and isolation, with so much going around in my head and not sleeping, but feeling exhausted.  
Then the phone rang, a wonderful young lady from the Admiral support network spoke to me.  
Without Caroline I don't know how I would have coped mentally.  
What a great asset these young ladies are to Dementia/Alzheimer patients and their careers. Please R.C.H. Treliske, support these nurses for the much needed wonderful work they do in the Dementia sector in Cornwall.  
I thank God everyday for that particular young lady  
I wish her well.

author: Madwife78
title: Paramedics went above and beyond
body:
I am writing this on behalf of my mum, who was helped by mark and Laura after an accident in a stairwell in early August 2020. Paramedics Mark and Laura went above and beyond  
They were kind, friendly, reassuring and went above and beyond for my family during a frightening time.  
Thank you
